message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CE 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.GT (Game Theory): The paper explicitly mentions the use of game theory to model the competition among service providers in an Edge-Cloud system. 
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the distribution of computing resources among edge providers and cloud providers, and the task distribution mechanism used to maximize revenue. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper focuses on computing service providers at the edge of the Internet and their interactions with cloud providers and clients. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses the design of a revenue sharing mechanism to maximize system-level efficiency in an Edge-Cloud computing system. 
5. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper applies game theory and revenue sharing mechanisms to design an efficient Edge-Cloud computing system, which can be seen as a computational engineering problem.
